body_content.explanation: A pay-to-play computer game is one that you have to pay money to play:
examples: Pay-to-play online gaming is very popular.
Pay to play games often have more features than their free counterparts.

body_content.explanation: involving or relating to the practice of getting an advantage of some kind in return for giving money to a government, organization, official, etc.:
examples: Pay-to-play laws stop corruption by limiting political donations.
Investigators say that 20 investment firms may have been involved in pay-to-play schemes.
Our legal system is pay to play, with advantage going to those who subsidize the court system.

body_content.explanation: the practice of paying money to play a computer game:
examples: Pay-to-play is often seen in big multiplayer online role-playing games.
Pay to play refers to online games that players must pay to access.

body_content.explanation: the practice of getting an advantage of some kind in return for giving money to a government, organization, official, etc.:
examples: The investigation found no evidence of pay-to-play.
Pay to play is the practice of elected officials granting favourable contracts to political contributors.
